description: This walk traverses Heathcote National Park and the Royal National Park, with swimming opportunities at Lake Eckerley and the Karloo Pools, and even a historic tram ride at the Loftus Tramway Museum on select days.

markers.description: Get the train to Waterfall using transportnsw.info.
From the station exit at the top of the strairs, follow Kooraban St to the right across the overpass.
From the intersection follow Warabin St right to the end.
From the trailhead at the end of Warabin St, pass the gate and follow the Bullawarring Track.
Follow the sign down the Bullawarring Track to the left.
Follow the rough steps down the scramble.
At the bottom of the scramble, follow the Bullawarring Track to the left.
Follow the sign to the Kingfisher Pool to the right.
Cross the creek at the 108 Trail and follow the sign to the Kingfisher Pool to the right.
There is a toilet at the picnic area before the Kingfisher Pools
From the Kingfisher pool follow the track to the campground.
Cross the creek at the campground and continue along the Bullawarring Track.
From the intersection with the Mooray Track, follow the sign to Lake Eckersley
Cross Myana Creek and continue following the Bullawarring Track.
From the intersection with the Goanna Track continue straight, following the sign to Lake Eckersley.
+0.5km Alternative follow the Goanna Track to the left for a shortcut to Lake Eckerley.
Follow the Goanna Track across the ridge, follow the pipeline trail right to Lake Eckersley.
From the side of the pipeline trail follow the sign to the left down to the lake.
The trail leads from the Pipeline Trail down to the lake shore.
From the lake continue following the Pipeline Trail to the Battery Causeway.
Cross the Battery Causeway and continue following the Pipeline Trail.
Optionally visit the Mirang Pool on the left side of the Pipeline Trail.
From stairs over the pipeline on the right side of the track, follow the sign to Heathcote Station.
Follow the Friendly Track to the Scout Hall.
From the Scout Hall follow Freeman Rd to the right.
At the intersection follow Boundary Rd to the left.
From the intersection follow Oliver St to the right.
There are amenities at the Heathcote shops.
There are public toilets at Veno Street Reserve.
Cross the pedestrian bridge across the Princess Hwy to Heathcote Station.
Get the train to/from Heathcote using transportnsw.info.
Exit the station to the right, to the Wilson Pde side of the station.
Follow the sign to the Karloo Track from the left side of Wilson Pde.
From the trail around the Fire Station follow the sign to the right down the Karloo Track.
Follow the trail along the ridge and down the rough steps at the end.
Cross Kangaroo Creek and find the trail sign near the Karloo Pools.
Follow the Karloo Track up the ridge from the sign at the pools.
Follow the painted markers across the rocky sections of the Karloo Track
The Karloo Track ends at Uloola Falls.
From the campground follow the sign to Waterfall a short distance to find a public toilet.
From the campground near the falls, follow sign down the Uloola Track.
Follow the Uloola Track along the ridge top.
At the intersection follow the sign to Audley.
Someone didn't feel like carrying it back down to Audley.
markers.title: Free lawnmower, needs minor fixes
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: From the intersection follow the sign left towards Engadine.
The trail ends a lookout overlooking Kangaroo Creek.
From the lookout follow the trail to the right.
Rough steps leads down the ridge.
From the intersection at the bottom of the ridge, follow the sign to Audley.
From the intersection continue straight on, following the sign to Audley.
The trail ends at the Currawong FLat Picnic Area.
At the picnic are cross the white bridge over the Hacking River.
From the bridge follow the road left to the amenities at the visitor centre.
Follow the path from the visitor centre to the carpark.
From the carpark follow the footpath to the left to the weir.
Cross the Hacking River across the weir.
From the other side of the weir, cross Audley Rd into the Bus Stop Flat Picnic Area.
There is a toilet block near the picnic area.
Follow the Honeymoon Track up the ridge from the left side of the toilet block.
At the top of the ridge follow the footpath past the park office.
Cross the road into the carpark and continue to the tram platform.
Check www.sydneytramwaymuseum.com.au if the historical tramway operates today.
You may be here on the lucky few days there is a historic tram ride to the Sydney Tramway Museum outside the park.
markers.title: Ding Ding Ding!
markers.instruction: Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy

markers.description: From the end of the platform follow Rawson Pde Trail along the tram line.
Follow the trail the right around the park depot.
From the end of the depot fence line, follow the Loftus Loop Track to the right.
At the split in the trail follow the the bike trail left along the Princess Hwy. Watch out for cyclists.
The bike trail end at the traffic lights near Loftus Station.
Use the traffic lights to cross the Princess Hwy safely.
Across the highway enter the carpark at the Tramway Museum.
Cross the carpark to Loftus Station.
Plan your return trip from Loftus at transportnsw.info.
+2kmIf time allows, consider following Old Princes Highway to Sutherland for a more frequent train service.
Follow the footpath along the sports fields.
From the Leisure Centre, follow the footpath along Old Princess Hwy under the overpass to the shops.
From the shops, cross the road to Sutherland Station.
Plan your return trip from Loftus at transportnsw.info.
